title: Research-Based Instructional Method Development for Improving the Professorial Design Theory Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary instructional design theory and understanding of mathematics pedagogy
context.additional_context: Aims to improve research-based teaching methods in a blended learning environment using digital devices, applying a continuous improvement process through formative assessments and learner feedback.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and comparatively explain components of the Instructional Design Theory Framework (ITF): instructional methods, delivery methods, and management methods
Learners can empirically validate the effectiveness of new media and instructional methods using a research-to-improve approach
Learners can design an instructional design framework optimized for the mathematics education domain and verify it through formative evaluation
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
